column4: guys I'm installing ubuntu at a friend of mine and I want to know, should I use ext3 as the primary and ext2 for the root file system or reverse
imho, the only file system to use is either ext3 or reiser. the journals make things soooo much faster for fsck's
and where should I put the root file system??
put root on a partition....I don't understand what u mean by "where"
and now, I have one "Linux" partition as ext3 40 gigs, I have an ext3 "root" partition 2150 MB and I have Linux Swap 300 MB, is that ok?
and now, I have one "Linux" partition as ext3 40 gigs, I have an ext3 "root" partition 2150 MB and I have Linux Swap 300 MB, is that ok?
it this going to be your primary OS?

what do u plan on doing with the 40gig partition? if it were my box and I were giving that much space to a secondary OS, I would give root maybe 20, the "Linux" partition 20, and the rest to swap. I know it sounds heavy on swap. but I have actually used over 1gb of swap on here...better safe that sorry.
I have 15 used on root..I dont delete anything in the apt cache....and I soooooo hate to run out of space on root. it isnt pretty
